metadata.title: CVE-2022-21166 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Incomplete cleanup in specific special register write operations for someIntel(R) Processors may allow an authenticated user to potentially enableinformation disclosure via local access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-21166` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

intel-microcode - 3.20220510.0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-5.15.0-39-generic - 5.15.0-39.42
linux-image-5.15.0-39-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-39.42
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-39-generic - 5.15.0-39.42
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-39-generic-64k - 5.15.0-39.42
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1012-kvm - 5.15.0-1012.14
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1013-aws - 5.15.0-1013.17
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1012-azure - 5.15.0-1012.15
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1019-azure-fde - 5.15.0-1012.15
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1010-gcp - 5.15.0-1010.15
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1010-gke - 5.15.0-1010.13
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1001-gkeop - 5.15.0-1001.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1009-ibm - 5.15.0-1009.11
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1010-intel-iotg - 5.15.0-1010.14
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-39-lowlatency - 5.15.0-39.42
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-39-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-39.42
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1011-oracle - 5.15.0-1011.15
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.17.0-1013-oem - 5.17.0-1013.14
No subscription required

criterions.comment: intel-microcode package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.20220510.0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-39.42').
linux-kvm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1012.14').
linux-aws package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1013.17').
linux-azure package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1012.15').
linux-azure-fde package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1012.15').
linux-gcp package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1010.15').
linux-gke package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1010.13').
linux-gkeop package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1001.2').
linux-ibm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1009.11').
linux-intel-iotg package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1010.14').
linux-lowlatency package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-39.42').
linux-oracle package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1011.15').
linux-oem-5.17 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.17.0-1013.14').
linux-oem-6.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-oem-6.1, was needs-triage').
